meanings.definition: To put in danger or at risk.
meanings.sent1: Running in the dark can jeopardise your safety.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a seatbelt can jeopardise your life in a car accident.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting your umbrella might jeopardise your hairdo in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warning signs can jeopardise your future success.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the stove on can jeopardise the entire house.

meanings.definition: To expose to loss or injury.
meanings.sent1: Leaving your phone unattended can jeopardise its security.
meanings.sent2: Sharing personal information online can jeopardise your privacy.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much candy might jeopardise your teeth.
meanings.sent4: Skipping regular check-ups can jeopardise your health in the long run.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the window open can jeopardise the warmth of the room.
